titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Russell Hoban Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:07

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Russell Hoban Papers, which span from 1952 to 2011, contain writings from throughout Russell Hoban's lifetime including novels, children's books, poetry, and opera librettos. The papers also contain clippings, ephemera, photographs, audiovisual materials, and electronic media related to Hoban's life and work.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 68, 74, 77, 86-87 (digital media): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 69, 73, 78, 85 (audiovisual materials): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, Inc. on the Jockey Hollow Fund and on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2016.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Writings, 1956-2011. II. Correspondence, 1963-2011. III.Writings on Russell and Lillian Hoban, 1964-2002. IV. Diaries, 1956-2005. V. Artwork, circa 1952-1980.

bioghist.head: Russell Hoban (1925-2011)
bioghist.p: Russell Hoban (1925-2011) was an American author who wrote novels, poetry, operatic librettos, and children's books. Notably, he collaborated with illustrator and author Lillian Hoban, to whom he was married from 1944-1972, on the "Frances the Badger" children's books.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Russell Hoban Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Russell Hoban Collection. Related materials: Lillian Hoban Papers (GEN MSS 1199). Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of writings, drawings, posters, correspondence, other papers, and audiovisual materials related to the life and work of Russell Hoban. The writings and drawings document Hoban's career as a novelist, librettist, and children's book author including the Frances books he collaborated on with his former wife, Lillian Hoban.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Russell Hoban Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials within this series maintain the original physical organization found at time of acquisition with the exception of some oversized materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains materials related to Russell Hoban's writings. Materials within this series are organized under seven headings: children's books, scripts and librettos, poems, short stories, essays and short fiction, novels, and unsorted notes, writings, and ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Apple IIe is contained within its original carrying case. The keyboard keys are imprinted with Arabic letters, either painted on or engraved. It's possible these modifications are related to Russell Hoban's 1983 novel Pilgermann.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material within this series maintain the original physical organization found at time of acquisition with the exception of some oversized materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence between Russell Hoban and many other authors, composers, and creatives, along with ephemera sometimes included with the correspondence. The material documents personal and business relationships related to Russell Hoban.
